intro: Dracophyllum arboreum, commonly known as the tree heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often in heathland or forested areas. Its leaves are leathery and glossy, and it produces fragrant, white or pinkish flowers during the spring and summer months. Dracophyllum arboreum is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils and can thrive in coastal or inland environments.
